answerText: Jane Austen[10] Oscar Wilde details the vanity and meaninglessness of his relationship with Alfred, Lord Douglas in this letter written from Reading Gaol. Its second section shows Wilde's spiritual side and his opinions on Christianity.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 3 | 2 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Many English authors dabbled in the art of letter writing. For 10 points each: [10] Surely the most humorous and caustic letter writer was this correspondent of her sister, Cassandra. When not talking about having the hots for Tom Lefroy, she may have discussed her novels, such as Sense and Sensibility.
